channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SUREFIRE-1439] NullPointerException on JDK10
item.description:
I'm having a NPE when testing the build on early access version of OpenJDK 10.

  • http://jdk.java.net/10/

Execution default-test of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test failed.: NullPointerException ->

more verbose:

org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test (default-test) on project hibernate-search-build-config: Execution default-test of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test failed.
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:213)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:154)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:146)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject(LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:117)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleModuleBuilder.buildProject(LifecycleModuleBuilder.java:81)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.builder.singlethreaded.SingleThreadedBuilder.build(SingleThreadedBuilder.java:51)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.LifecycleStarter.execute(LifecycleStarter.java:128)
	at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.doExecute(DefaultMaven.java:309)
	at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.doExecute(DefaultMaven.java:194)
	at org.apache.maven.DefaultMaven.execute(DefaultMaven.java:107)
	at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.execute(MavenCli.java:993)
	at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.doMain(MavenCli.java:345)
	at org.apache.maven.cli.MavenCli.main(MavenCli.java:191)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at java.base/jdk.internal.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:564)
	at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launchEnhanced(Launcher.java:289)
	at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.launch(Launcher.java:229)
	at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.mainWithExitCode(Launcher.java:415)
	at org.codehaus.plexus.classworlds.launcher.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:356)
Caused by: org.apache.maven.plugin.PluginExecutionException: Execution default-test of goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.20.1:test failed.
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.DefaultBuildPluginManager.executeMojo(DefaultBuildPluginManager.java:145)
	at org.apache.maven.lifecycle.internal.MojoExecutor.execute(MojoExecutor.java:208)
	... 20 more
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.maven.surefire.shade.org.apache.commons.lang3.SystemUtils.isJavaVersionAtLeast(SystemUtils.java:1626)
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.getEffectiveJvm(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:2107)
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.getForkConfiguration(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:1976)
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeProvider(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:1111)
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.executeAfterPreconditionsChecked(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:954)
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.surefire.AbstractSurefireMojo.execute(AbstractSurefireMojo.java:832)
	at org.apache.maven.plugin.DefaultBuildPluginManager.executeMojo(DefaultBuildPluginManager.java:134)
	... 21 more

To reproduce, checkout te Hibernate Search project:

  • https://github.com/hibernate/hibernate-search.git

But I believe it doesn't matter which project and/or settings are being used.

For the record, I was using git commit id cda6a02d1 - which coincidentally was about upgrading to latest surefire version.
The parent commit 451449cac seems unaffected.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi,

I tried to build Hibernate with a custom build of Surefire - upgrading the dependency to Commons Lang 3.7 to include the resolved LANG-1365 and can confirm it's working fine with JDK10 build 10-ea+32 (Except I'm having other problems due to Surefire's handling of javax.transaction.Synchronization but we'll investigate those separately).

Unfortunately to build this version of Surefire I also had to change the build to use JDK7. I'm going to assume this is not acceptable?

This is the error detail:

Restricted to JDK 1.6 yet org.apache.commons:commons-lang3:jar:3.7:compile contains org/apache/commons/lang3/arch/Processor$Arch.class targeted to JDK 1.7
Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.EnforceBytecodeVersion failed with message:
Found Banned Dependency: org.apache.commons:commons-lang3:jar:3.7

FYI, for upgrading commons-lang, there's no need to rebuild surefire. It is possible to add dependencies to a plugin in your pom.

I suggest we switch to plexus-java to do versions calculations, so we don't need to upgrade commons-lang with every new version of Java.

Hi rfscholte! Glad to "meet" you again after talking with you at FOSDEM.. we were at the same table at the JDK dinner

I'm afraid I can't override the plugin dependency, it looks like it's being shaded into the plugin, look at the class name in the stacktrace:
org.apache.maven.surefire.shade.org.apache.commons.lang3.SystemUtils
Hi sanne, if commons-lang is shaded, you're indeed out of luck.

sanne
sanne.grinovero
What you have in system property java.specification.version on Java 10?
Feel free to check the code and debug org.apache.commons.lang3.JavaVersion, method get().
It should be working with enum JAVA_RECENT unless Oracle changed the pattern in java.specification.version.
Maybe JDK has a bug.

The problem is that JavaVersion is an enum. This means that it must be extended every half year with the new release cycle of Java. And it has already been fixed with LANG-1365, but the shading makes it impossible to upgrade the dependency within the plugin configuration.
I would like to switch to the JavaVersion of plexus-java, because it simply parses the any value, e.g java.version, which means there's no requirement to keep up with the early access build of the JDK.

It has nothing to do with existing or not existing enum.
The NPE is because this method:
static JavaVersion get(final String nom) {
returns null.
And it returns null because Oracle changed the format.

Tibor, the format just follows JEP223 as introduced by Java9. So yes, the static method returns null, but it's a commons-lang issue. Also see the confirmation in first comment: upgrading to the latest commons-lang fixes this issue.

rfscholte
I need to check javac version on commons-lang3. I hope it is compiled with 1.6.
Worst case scenario: add a profile with jdk activation for 9 where you use commons-lang 3.7 as dependency
